text: Take it up with Ernest Hemingway, George Orwell, Kurt Vonnegut, and Joseph Heller: all of whom literally killed fascists in the Spanish Civil War and World War II.
George Orwell and Ernest Hemingway were literally anti-fascists. They fought fascists in the Spanish Civil War. https://twitter.com/ThomasWictor/status/1021910210326093825 …

The viral image is real, was taken during the Spanish Civil War, and truly does show Ernest Hemingway in the background. However, the featured war reporter holding a puppy is not George Orwell. https://twitter.com/profjmb/status/1020792636632961024 …

In this video, I look at how the Spanish Civil War shaped the literature of the modernist movement. George Orwell and Ernest Hemingway both visited Spain during the war, and T.S. Eliot and W.H. Auden asked questions about a poet's duty in the modern world. https://youtu.be/30_vpxuWx4c

# interestingbackstory famous novelist Ernest Hemingway met George Orwell early in his career when they both volunteered for the Republic of Spain in the Spanish Civil War they would respectively write For Whom the Bells Toll and Homage to Catalonia the latter being less succesful

Here are three book tips for those who want to know more about the Spanish Civil War: Arthur Koestler's 'Spanish Testament', George Orwell's 'Homage to Catalonia' and of course Hemingway's 'For Whom the Bell tolls'. Have fun while reading.
